rationale: No use case directly relates to the goal of modernizing management and delivery.
No use case directly describes creating an integrated and secure platform.
UC-1 and UC-14 detail the purchase flow where users scan a QR code using a mobile application.
UC-2 outlines the dashboard that shows statistics on sales and malfunctions.
UC-2 allows administrators to monitor stats, while UC-5 and UC-7 help in planning maintenance and replenishing.
The requirement is vague and no use case specifies an improvement in user experience.
No use case is focused on reducing response times for operators.
No use case references scalability or alignment with modern technologies.
Inventory tracking is indirectly handled in UC-2 and UC-4 through sales and restocking.
UC-1 and UC-4 mention digital wallet usage during transactions.
Admin management in UC-5 and UC-24 provides centralization capabilities for operations.
UC-1 details digital payment integration which aligns with remote monitoring.
User registration and login in UC-3 allow viewing wallet balance and transaction history.
UC-4 details how users recharge their wallets using cash or online methods.
UC-1 and UC-14 mention automatic deduction from the user's digital wallet upon purchase.
Admin configuration and management capabilities are covered in these use cases.
UC-6 outlines CRUD functionality for users and distributors, aligning with the requirement.
UC-7 describes automatic reports generated for maintenance based on supply status.
No use case mentions detecting vending machines not connected to the Internet.
There is no use case related to maintaining an offline register for tracking transactions.
No use case discusses the synchronization of local transactions post connectivity restoration.
No use case supports transactions for anonymous users using cash only.
There are no specific use cases detailing required infrastructure.
UC-3, UC-9, and UC-10 manage user authentication for accessing the personalized interface.
The verification of user credentials is described in the login use cases.
UC-10 includes handling error messages for incorrect credentials.
UC-3 outlines the process of user registration which includes required fields.
Field validation during registration is part of the workflow in UC-3.
UC-24 describes the creation of a new vending machine.
Saving new vending machine information in the database is included in UC-24.
UC-24 involves verifying data for creating new vending machines.
Error messaging during saving is detailed in UC-24.
No use case supports communication between clients and machines.
UC-34 captures the tracking of active connections between users and machines.
UC-35 outlines the connection management between a user and a vending machine.
There are no current use cases focused on future development of additional features.
